medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain has been intermittent for 6 days, worsening after a fatty meal, particularly after eating a cheeseburger and a sandwich. The most recent episode was associated with awakening from sleep at 11 PM, more severe in intensity than previous episodes. Pain persists now for approximately 5 hours. The patient was pain-free between episodes and able to tolerate bland foods. There was one episode of sweating and chills last night, but no fevers.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hydradinitis; previous excision of axillary hydradinitis; I&D of left thigh abscess secondary to hydradinitis.
